nodes.text: Gulli-ball stadiums were home to the Gungan's most popular sport, gulliball. Hundreds if not thousands of Gungans would watch eagerly from the stands of the stadium to see their favorite teams whip around the Gullipud with poles. Gulli-ball stadiums probably also functioned as Nuna-ball stadiums. The stadium was lit with many light orbs that attached to the bubble supports of the building. A bubble was suspended over the field that displayed the teams' scores and time remaining. To signal half-time bogwings would be released.
